section.title: Elver Persistency has moved to Eclipse.org as Teneo within EMFT

p.strong: Elver persistency has moved to eclipse.org as the Teneo project within EMFT:

ul.li: The elver.org website will remain the source for documentation of Teneo.
The source code can be retrieved from Eclipse cvs. The new main java package name: org.eclipse.emf.teneo.

Teneo/Elver is part of the EMFT build process, builds can be downloaded here: EMFT Downloads (select the Teneo project in the listbox). For the Eclipse update manager use: http://download.eclipse.org/technology/emft/updates/site-interim.xml.
Support is given on the EMFT newsgroup: news://news.eclipse.org/eclipse.technology.emft.

section.title: EMF Persistency Solution using Hibernate
section.p: The EMF - Hibernate integration currently supports a number of important EMF features and standard Hibernate features. EMF objects can be persisted in most major relational databases and retrieved using an EMF resource approach or HQL queries.

p.strong: Current version (Teneo): 0.7.5 BETA (last updated on 13 September 2006) for Eclipse 3.2/EMF 2.2/Hibernate3.2 (and Hibernate 3.1.3) and jdk 1.4 and later, Status, Features, Changelog

section.p: Releases are not guaranteed to be backward compatible. When upgrading: please read the Changelog and the Upgrading pages.

p.em: For troubleshooting please visit the Known Issues and Troubleshooting pages.

section.title: Hibernate
section.p: The EMF - Hibernate integration is a layer over the Hibernate product. The used Hibernate version is 3.2. For more information visit Hibernate at http://www.hibernate.org.

section.title: EMF
section.p: The Eclipse Modeling Framwork (EMF) is a modeling and code generation framework which generates source code from different sources: an UML diagram or a XML Schema. For more information see here.
